name: walleye
notes:
>located in the lake-country of northern minnesota, voyageurs national park protects 218,054 acres. this includes roughly 84,000 acres of water that provides opportunities to aspiring and experienced anglers alike. a total of 54 fish species have been found in the park's aquatic habitats, but walleye remains a favorite.

**difficulty:** easy â€“ medium

**size:** keep the size a mystery! pick out yarn for your walleye and use the recommended hook size. once your walleye is finished be sure to check the [minnesota dnr fishing regulations][1] to see if your fish falls within the slot limit!

**material:**
1. crochet hook (use recommended size for your chosen yarn)
2. yarn (example walleye used a multi-colored yarn to create the pattern you see)
3. fiber fill
4. sewing needle


  [1]: https://www.dnr.state.mn.us/regulations/fishing/index.html
